name: Gigi's Wonderfood Organic Veggie Crisps
description: Gigi’s Wonderfood is an organic whole food for freshwater shrimp, community fish and snails.  Each crisp is full of nutritious vitamins, minerals and color enhancing astaxanthins from real organic vegetables.  I never add artificial colors, additives, preservatives or soy/wheat fillers. I use only honest to goodness ingredients for the health and well-being of aquatic animals. You can crumble the crisps so they float then sink feeding your whole tank or you can keep the pieces larger and they will sink right down to your substrate feeders. Ingredient list: organic peas, organic green beans, organic kale, organic carrots, organic alfalfa leaf, organic spirulina algae, organic stinging nettles. Qty. 1.25 oz. MSRP $12.00 Suggested retail price. Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $10.00, with other items FREE

name: Indian Almond Leaves (Terminalia catappa)
description: Catappa leaves are respected throughout the world for their enzymatic complexity and overall benefit to aquariums. The bacteria that grows on the outside is a live food for shrimp and fry. The pesticide free leaves naturally contain humic acids and tannins which have anti-fungal properties which help heal cuts and scratches on fish and shrimp and also help in shrimp molting and lessen the likelihood of egg fungus. Catappa leaves promote general health and vitality. Qty. Sold in packages of 4 large leaves or 6 small leaves. Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5.00, with other items FREE

name: Cholla Wood (Cylindropuntia imbricate)
description: Cholla wood is actually a desert cactus that is dried and then broken into six inch portions. The pieces are very decorative with a neutral pH. Their hollows provide excellent cover for shrimplets and fry. This is a fabulous for attaching rhizome plants and tucking mosses. Cholla wood is excellent fiber source for plecostomus Qty. Each package is different but consists of four pieces of six inches each. Photo is just an example. Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $5, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $10, with other items FREE

name: Catechu Bark (Acacia catechu)
description: We really like Acacia catechu. It is pro-biotic in several ways. First off, it provides a rad home for infusoria and fry. See in the picture how it is all fluffy? That fluffy holds alot of empty space and all the microguys live in there and are safe to breed. This means higher shrimplet and fry survivability rates for sure but also, eventually, the infusoria travel out of this area and your bigger fish will eat them. Catechu bark is essentially a live food generator inside your tank. Catechu bark is a powerful antibiotic and will reduce infections. What that means in real terms is that if your fish gets a body scratch or your shrimp gets a crack in its carapace, both will be less likely to become infected because the biocomplexity of the tank includes these unique attributes. The light from your aquarium will create a biofilm on the outside of the bark and shrimp, fry and microguys will all eat that too. The bark is packed with tannins. You can use them or not. If you want to make a blackwater environment this is pure gold. Same if you want to lower pH for some species. Most of the time we don't need the tannins so we soak the bark in water for a few days, changing water often, and then drop the bark in the tank after the water runs clear enough showing that the tannins have come out. Vary rare. Buy it before we run out again. Qty. 10 grams Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5, with other items FREE

name: White Mulberry Leaves (Morus alba)
description: Mulberry leaves are a favorite of shrimp to snack on. This is a leaf where the shrimp will tear it apart for sheer taste enjoyment, much like a blanched zucchini or other vegetable. Our mulberry leaves are domestically produced using organic growing standards. Mulberry leaves are packed with trace minerals that most water animals get from leaves falling into their pools, ponds or rivers. Mulberry nutrition aids in shrimp molting and shrimplet survival rates. In addition to the advantages of the leaf itself, the aquarium light will form a biofilm on the leaf that shrimplets, fry and others will graze on as an around the clock live food opportunity. Qty. Five grams Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5.00, with other items FREE

name: Banana Leaf Sheets (Musa sapientum)
description: Banana leaves increase aquarium biocomplexity in several ways. The aquarium light acts on the banana sheets by creating a living biofilm that slowly eats the leaf. Your small animals like shrimp, snails, fry and infusoria all eat this biofilm as a live food around the clock. Also, the slowly degrading leaf provides lots of cover for fry and infusoria. All your tank inhabitants will be healthier and better fed when all the base layers of biology are thriving to support the higher life forms in the tank. You will get increases fry and shrimplets survival rates too. Some say that banana leaves increase animal color, especially Betta, but we have not found reliable scientific support for that yet. When bought in sheet form, you can tear the pieces however you wish. You will likely enjoy the effect the leaves have on the overall feeling of the tank. Qty. 1.25 oz. Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5.00, with other items FREE

name: Catappa Bark (Terminalia catappa)
description: Discourage parasites, bacterial infections and egg fungus naturally with Catappa Bark. Adding Catappa Bark to your tank increases water biocomplexity for overall aquarium health. Catappa Bark is particularly potent and no more than 1 gram (about half a stick) should be used per 5 gallons of water. Qty. 10 grams Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5, with other items FREE

name: Dulce Bark (Pithecellobium dulce)
description: Dulce Bark is an excellent anti-fungal and can prevent fungus from growing on shrimp and fish eggs. Using Dulce Bark in your aquarium will increase the water biocomplexity which is beneficial to fish and shrimp health. Dulce Bark will also release tannins in the water which can lower pH in large amounts. Qty. 10 grams Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5.00, with other items FREE

name: Guava Leaves (Psidium guajava)
description: These very beautiful guava leaves strongly discourage bacterial infections. This means if your fish gets a body cut or your shrimp gets a crack in its carapace that it will be less likely to become infected. The leaf is slow to break down and will allow a biofilm to grow that will become a live food source for shrimp, fry and other small lifeforms. Qty. 5 leaves Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5.00, with other items FREE

name: Teak Leaves (Tectona grandis)
description: The biofilm that naturally grows on Teak Leaves is an excellent source of infusoria (microscopic live food) for shrimp and fish fry. Teak Leaves are an excellent alternative to using Catappa Leaves as they release less colorful tannins and are slower to break down in the aquarium. Teak Leaves are currently being studied for their anti-bacterial properties. Qty. 10 grams. Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5.00, with other items FREE

name: Padang Cassia (Cinnamomum burmanii)
description: This fresh Padang Cassia looks like the cinnamon that we put in hot cider but it is actually different than store bought Cinnamomum zeylanicum. This bark is an intensive natural antibiotic & antifungal. Because it is curved protecting a center hollow area, it provides excellent cover for shrimplets and fry and an easy to experiment with price. Qty. 5 pieces Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5, with other items FREE

name: Banana Leaf Twists (Musa sapientum))
description: Banana leaves increase aquarium biocomplexity in several ways. The aquarium light acts on the banana leaf by creating a living biofilm that slowly eats the leaf. Your small animals like shrimp, snails, fry and infusoria all eat this biofilm as a live food around the clock. When tied into twists, this degradation process is slower than full sheets. Also, the slowly degrading leaf provides lots of cover for fry and infusoria. All your tank inhabitants will be healthier and better fed when all the base layers of biology are thriving to support the higher life forms in the tank. You will get increases fry and shrimplets survival rates too. Some say that banana leaves increase animal color, especially Betta, but we have not found reliable scientific support for that yet. Many people find the twists to be fancy and visually attractive. Qty. 5 pieces Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5.00, with other items FREE

name: Wildcrafted Alder Cones (Alnus rubra)
description: Alder tree cones lower pH and create beneficial micro-foods (infusoria) for fish fry and shrimp. Cones naturally contain beneficial humic acids and tannins. Promotes health and vitality in tropical shrimp and black water fish. Sustainably collected domestically from pollutant free areas. Qty. 30 piecces Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $3.00, with other items FREE International: Shipped alone $5.00, with other items FREE

name: Akadama Clay
description: Akadama clay or soil is used in making wabi-kusa, paludariums and especially as a substrate for sensitive shrimp. Akadama is Japanese for “red ball earth” and is a result of the eruptions of Mt. Fuji on Honshu Island. The eruptions caused a red soil to form and mix with the native black soil and then was compressed for many generations. Akadama clay is the result of this process. All brands of akadama are no longer importable into the United States because it was found to have traces of root fibers in the naturally occurring clay. When we our inventory runs out, we will have no more so buy and hoard it now. It is our preferred substrate for shrimp tanks because it has the quality of balancing water chemistry. If your ammonia or nitrates, for example, spike, the akadama will tend to absorb excesses buying you a bit more time to do a water change. Eventually the soil will release whatever it absorbed but it acts like a buffer for spikes in the short term. The varied surface of the individual pieces are very suitable for foraging shrimp, infusoria and shrimplet survival. Other folks use akadama for making wabi-kusa soil balls. They appreciate the chemistry balancing as described above but are usually using it as a larger granual outside layer to a root ball. Also, akadama holds ferts well and some aquarists supercharge the clay with ferts before wrapping it into the wabi-kusa. Qty. One Quart Bag Shipping Domestic (USA): Shipped alone $5.50, with other items $5.50 International: This item not available internationally. This product can be shipped within the US only.

name: Handmade Spawning Mops
description:
Perfect for egg depositing fish like killies, danios, discus and many others.  Made with acrylic yarn that has been carefully processed to remove excess dye.  Mops come with a removable recycled sterilized cork that can be replaced with a small rock to make the mop sink.  Handmade with love on Vashon Island.

Sold in packages of two so you can have a rotation system for optimum fry survival.

name: Bamboo Love Hotel
description: Our shrimp love these and so will yours.  Bamboo Love Hotels provide protection and a feeling of safety for young shrimplets and molting adults.  Your egg heavy mama shrimp will be grateful for a location to rest too.  The nooks and crannies provide an awesome habitat for beneficial living micro-foods (infusoria) and the bacteria that grows on the exterior is a living food too.  Made from untreated authentic black bamboo and aquarium grade silicone. Grown in a pesticide-free environment.  Handmade with love on Vashon Island.

name: Men's/Unisex Neocaridina T - Celeste Green on Indigo
description:
This is the only shrimp shirt we have that is printed on a tri-blend American Apparel shirt.  They take three tones of indigo thread and weave them together for a beautiful mix.  On top of that we lovingly applied celeste green ink.  The minty colored shrimp pops right off the indigo color field.  This is a seriously soft garment.

Made with American Apparel shirts which are exceptionally soft and made in America by happy and diverse employees that are paid a livable wage.

We chose to use QCM phthalate free plastisol which is an industry leader containing no heavy metals, voc's, or phthalates. 100% Non-Toxic for a healthy environment
